ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
dbus:
- '1'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
libboost_devel:
- '1.88'
numpy:
- '2'
openssl:
- '3.5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
zlib:
- '1'

name: robotraconteur-suite

about.summary: Communication framework for robotics and automation
Communication framework for robotics and automation

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.7" %}

package:
  name: robotraconteur-suite
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/robotraconteur/robotraconteur/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: ae4e1da1a3600bcf09fdd47bd1a46644d1da0259ff4ea9938d0f628a3a6b22c4
  - url: http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/bluetooth/bluez-5.56.tar.xz  # [linux]
    sha256: 59c4dba9fc8aae2a6a5f8f12f19bc1b0c2dc27355c7ca3123eed3fe6bd7d0b9d  # [linux]
    folder: bluez-src  # [linux]

build:
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - numpy

outputs:
  - name: librobotraconteur
    script: build_cpp.sh  # [unix]
    script: bld_cpp.bat  # [win]
    build:
      run_exports:
        - {{ pin_subpackage("librobotraconteur", min_pin='x.x.x') }}
    requirements:
      build:
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - ninja  # [win]    
        - make  # [unix]
        - git
        - cmake
        - swig
      host:
        - libboost-devel
        - dbus  # [linux]
        - zlib  # [linux]
        - openssl  # [unix]
        - libusb  # [linux]

    test:
      commands:
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/include/RobotRaconteur.h  # [not win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\include\\RobotRaconteur.h (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libRobotRaconteurCore${SHLIB_EXT}  # [not win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\lib\\RobotRaconteurCore.lib (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\bin\\RobotRaconteurCore.dll (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]

  - name: robotraconteur
    script: build_py.sh  # [unix]
    script: bld_py.bat  # [win]

    build:
      run_exports:
        - {{ pin_subpackage("robotraconteur", min_pin='x.x') }}
      force_use_keys:
        - python
        - numpy
    requirements:
      build:
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - ninja  # [win]    
        - make  # [unix]
        - git
        - cmake
        - swig
        - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - pip                                    # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
      host:
        - {{ pin_subpackage("librobotraconteur", exact=True) }}
        - python
        - numpy
        - setuptools
        - libboost-devel
        - pip

      run:
        - {{ pin_subpackage("librobotraconteur", min_pin='x.x.x') }}
        - python
        - numpy

    test:
      commands:
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/include/RobotRaconteur.h  # [not win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\include\\RobotRaconteur.h (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libRobotRaconteurCore${SHLIB_EXT}  # [not win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\lib\\RobotRaconteurCore.lib (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]
        - if exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\bin\\RobotRaconteurCore.dll (exit 0) else (exit 1)  # [win]
        - python -c "from RobotRaconteur.Client import RRN; print(RRN.RobotRaconteurVersion)"

about:
  home: http://robotraconteur.com
  dev_url: https://github.com/robotraconteur/robotraconteur
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Communication framework for robotics and automation'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - traversaro
    - johnwason

about.summary: Communication framework for robotics and automation
